biography.value:
Aaron Miller

Terrifying storms manifest in the bodies of elder tempests. Beings carved from clouds, wind, rain, and lightning, elder tempests assume the shape of serpents that slither through the sky. They drown the land beneath them with rain and stab the earth with lances of lightning. Punishing winds scream around them as they fly, feeding the chaos they create.

description.value: The tempest makes two Thunderous Slam attacks.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+16]]{+16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 23 ([[/damage 4d6 + 9 type=thunder]]) damage.

Each creature within 120 feet of the tempest must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=21]] saving throw, taking 27 ([[/damage 6d8 type=lightning]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also &Reference[condition=stunned] until the end of its next turn.
The tempest can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
The tempest doesn't provoke @action[opportunity attack||opportunity attacks] when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
If the tempest fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

activation.condition: If the tempest fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

description.value: The tempest is always at the center of a storm [[/r 1d6 + 4]] miles in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) checks that rely on hearing. In addition, strong winds swirl in the area covered by the storm. The winds impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. They also extinguish open flames and disperse fog.
The tempest deals double damage to objects and structures.
The tempest moves up to its speed.

The tempest can cause a bolt of lightning to strike a point on the ground anywhere under its storm. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=21]] saving throw, taking 16 ([[/damage 3d10 type=lightning]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The tempest releases a blast of thunder and wind in a line that is 300 feet long and 20 feet wide. Objects in that area take 22 ([[/damage 4d10 type=thunder]]) damage. Each creature there must succeed on a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=21]] saving throw or take 22 ([[/damage 4d10 type=thunder]]) damage and be flung up to 60 feet in a direction away from the line. If a thrown target collides with an immovable object (such as a wall or floor) or another creature, the target takes 3 ([[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning]]) damage for every 10 feet it was thrown before impact. If the target collides with another creature, that other creature must succeed on a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=19]] saving throw or take the same impact damage and be knocked &Reference[condition=prone].

The elder tempest can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The elder tempest regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • @UUID[Actor.JS8S1G2tohEG7IAW.Item.UM3CUF09GQblHRLf]{Move}
  • @UUID[Actor.JS8S1G2tohEG7IAW.Item.8STBLodvN8u1gjWM]{Lightning Strike}
  • @UUID[Actor.JS8S1G2tohEG7IAW.Item.E4L3EGSY0CJNZ3XZ]{Screaming Gale}
